response_metadata.response_text:
{
"overview": "",
"appropriations": "The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs requests the Committee on Finance to consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities. [CHUNK_3] [CHUNK_4] This is intended to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [CHUNK_4]",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "",
"agency_impact": "",
"economic_impact": "",
"policy_impact": "",
"revenue_sources": "",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "Your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs respectfully requests your Committee on Finance, should it deliberate on this measure, to consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities. [CHUNK_3] [CHUNK_4] This authorization would account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [CHUNK_4]",
"operating_revenue_impact": "",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs requests that the Committee on Finance consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities. [CHUNK_3] [CHUNK_4] This is to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [CHUNK_4]",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs has requested that the Committee on Finance consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects. [CHUNK_3] This differs from the previous note which detailed a $9.9 million appropriation for specific projects. [CHUNK_4] The new request is to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [CHUNK_4]"
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: HSCR286 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 286 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 400 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs, to which was referred H.B. No. 400 entitled: "A BILL

to which was referred H.B. No. 400 entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE JUDICIARY," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the 2025-2027 fiscal biennium for certain operating expenses of the Judiciary. Your Committee received testimony in support

expenses of the Judiciary. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the Judiciary; Volunteer Legal Services Hawai ʻ i; Legal Aid Society of Hawai ʻ i; The Legal Clinic; and two individuals. Your Committee finds that the appropriations made by this measure will assist the Judiciary in

appropriations made by this measure will assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional, statutory, and public service duties. Your Committee respectfully requests your Committee on Finance, should it deliberate on this measure, to consider authorizing $7,000,000 in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects

lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 to relocate the Children's Justice Center. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs that is attached to this

on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 400 and recommends that it pass Second Reading and be referred to your Committee on Finance. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee
Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs, ____________________________ DAVID A. TARNAS, Chair

numbers_data.text: i; The Legal Clinic; and two individuals. Your Committee finds that the appropriations made by this measure will assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional, statutory, and public service duties. Your Committee respectfully requests your Committee on Finance, should it deliberate on this measure, to consider authorizing $7,000,000 in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 to relocate the Children's Justice Center. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs that is attached to

its efforts to fulfill its constitutional, statutory, and public service duties. Your Committee respectfully requests your Committee on Finance, should it deliberate on this measure, to consider authorizing $7,000,000 in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 to relocate the Children's Justice Center. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 400 and recommends that it pass Second
